It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, and it produces attractive, tuberous roots. Bomarea campanularia is appreciated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
